<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a downgrade of these notes below an investment grade rating by each of Moody&#146;s Investors Service, Inc., Standard&nbsp;&amp; Poor&#146;s Ratings Services and Fitch, Inc. within
a specified period. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We expect to continue to comply with our long-term debt covenants. Refer to our Form 10-K for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2008 for further details of these debt offerings. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We refinance long-term and short-term debt from time to time. The nature and amount of
our long-term and short-term debt and the proportionate amount of each varies as a result of future business requirements, market conditions and other factors. At June&nbsp;30, 2009, we had approximately $3.0 billion remaining in long-term financing
authority from our Board of Directors. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements and Aggregate Contractual Obligations </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We have no off-balance sheet arrangements other than the guarantees and contractual obligations that are discussed below and in our Form 10-K for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2008. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">38 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Guarantees: </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As
discussed in Note 10, <I>Commitments and Contingencies</I>, we have third-party guarantees because of our construction activities. As part of those transactions, we guarantee that third parties will make contractual payments or achieve performance
measures. At June&nbsp;30, 2009, the carrying amount of our third-party guarantees on our condensed consolidated balance sheet and the maximum potential payment under our third-party guarantees was $30 million. Substantially all of these guarantees
expire at various times through 2018. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition, at June&nbsp;30, 2009, we were contingently liable for $270 million of guarantees related to our own
performance. These include letters of credit related to dairy commodity purchases and guarantees related to the payment of custom duties and taxes, and other letters of credit. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Guarantees do not have, and we do not expect them to have, a material effect on our liquidity. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Equity and Dividends
</U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Stock Repurchases: </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Our $5.0 billion share
repurchase authority expired on March&nbsp;30, 2009. Prior to the expiration, we repurchased 130.9&nbsp;million shares for $4.3 billion under the program. We have not repurchased any shares in 2009. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Stock Plans: </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">At our annual meeting of shareholders held on
May&nbsp;20, 2009, our shareholders approved the Kraft Foods Inc. Amended and Restated 2005 Performance Incentive Plan. The amended plan includes, among other provisions, a limit on the number of shares that may be granted under the plan, vesting
restrictions and a prohibition on stock option repricing. Under the amended plan, we are authorized to issue a maximum of 168.0&nbsp;million shares of our Common Stock. As of the effective date of the amendment, there were 92.1 million shares
available to be granted under the plan, of which no more than 27.5&nbsp;million shares may be awarded as restricted or deferred stock. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In January 2009, we
granted 1.4&nbsp;million shares of stock in connection with our long-term incentive plan. The market value per share was $27.00 on the date of grant. The unvested shares have no voting rights and do not pay dividends. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In February 2009, as part of our annual incentive program, we issued 4.1&nbsp;million shares of restricted and deferred stock to eligible U.S. and non-U.S. employees.
The market value per restricted or deferred share was $23.64 on the date of grant. Also, as part of our annual incentive program, we granted 16.3&nbsp;million stock options to eligible U.S. and non-U.S. employees at an exercise price of $23.64.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We also issued 0.2&nbsp;million off-cycle shares of restricted and deferred stock during the first six months of 2009. The weighted-average market value
per restricted or deferred share was $24.90 on the date of grant. In aggregate, we issued 5.7&nbsp;million restricted and deferred shares during the first six months of 2009, including those issued as part of our long-term incentive plan.
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><I>Dividends: </I></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We paid dividends of $855 million in the
first six months of 2009 and $826 million in the first six months of 2008. The 3.5% increase reflects a higher dividend rate in 2009, partially offset by a lower number of shares outstanding resulting from the split-off of the <I>Post</I> cereals
business. The present annualized dividend rate is $1.16 per common share. The declaration of dividends is subject to the discretion of our Board of Directors and depends on various factors, including our net earnings, financial condition, cash
requirements, future prospects and other factors that our Board of Directors deems relevant to its analysis and decision making. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>2009 Outlook
</U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We increased our guidance for 2009 diluted EPS to at least $1.93 versus the prior expectation of $1.88. This guidance reflects strong year-to-date
performance as well as incremental investments in marketing and cost-saving initiatives to drive future growth. Our outlook for a 31.5% full-year effective tax rate remains unchanged. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The factors described in the &#147;Risk Factors&#148; section of our Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, represent continuing risks to these forecasts. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">39 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Significant Accounting Estimates </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We prepare our condensed consolidated financial statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. The preparation of these financial statements requires the use of
estimates, judgments and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the periods presented. Actual results could differ from
those estimates and assumptions. Our significant accounting policies are described in Note 1 to our consolidated financial statements in our Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. Our significant accounting estimates are described in
Management&#146;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations included in our Form 10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008. The impact of new accounting standards is discussed in the following section. There were
no changes in our accounting policies in the current period that had a material impact on our financial statements, other than those discussed in Note 1, <I>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</I>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>New Accounting Standards </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">See Note 1, <I>Summary of
Significant Accounting Policies</I>, for a discussion of new accounting standards. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Contingencies </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">See Note 10, <I>Commitments and Contingencies</I>, and Part II, Item&nbsp;1. <I>Legal Proceedings</I> for a discussion of contingencies. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Forward-Looking Statements </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This report contains
forward-looking statements regarding the impact of certain accounting pronouncements on our financial results; with regard to our Restructuring Program, that we will use cash to pay for a portion of the charges and our expected cumulative annualized
savings; our belief regarding the disclosure of implementation charges under the Restructuring Program; that aligning our Central Europe operations into our Kraft Foods Developing Markets segment will keep Kraft Foods Europe management fully focused
on implementing the new structure and growing the business; our belief that disclosing segment operating income helps investors analyze segment performance and trends; our belief regarding the change in method of valuing our U.S. inventories; our
expectation regarding the effect of unrealized appreciation or depreciation; our belief that commodity prices will continue to be volatile over the remainder of the year; our belief regarding our liquidity; our belief regarding our funding sources;
our expectation regarding 2009 funding of our pension plans and our expectation to fund these contributions from operations; our expectation regarding full-year capital expenditures and our expectation to fund capital expenditures from operations;
our intention to redeem our November 2011, 7% $200 million debenture at par value and our expected loss from redemption; our expectation to repay long-term debt that matures in November 2009 with cash from operations or through the issuance of
commercial paper; the effect of Lehman&#146;s bankruptcy on our revolving credit facility; our expectation to continue to meet the financial covenant under our revolving credit facility; our expectation to continue to comply with our long-term debt
covenants; the effect of guarantees on our liquidity; our 2009 Outlook specifically, diluted EPS, that our increase in 2009 diluted EPS reflects strong year-to-date performance as well as incremental investments in marketing and cost-saving
initiatives to drive future growth, and our full-year effective tax rate; and our belief that the final outcome of our legal proceedings will not materially affect our financial results. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">These forward-looking statements involve risks and uncertainties, and the cautionary statements set forth below and those contained in the &#147;Risk Factors&#148; found in our Form 10-K for the year ended
December&nbsp;31, 2008, identify important factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from those predicted in any such forward-looking statements. Such factors, include, but are not limited to, continued volatility in input costs,
pricing actions, increased competition, our ability to differentiate our products from private label products, increased costs of sales, difficulty in obtaining materials from our suppliers, the ability to supply our products and meet demand for our
products, our indebtedness and our ability to repay our indebtedness, unexpected safety or manufacturing issues, FDA or other regulatory actions or delays, unanticipated expenses such as litigation or legal settlement expenses, a shift in our
product mix to lower margin offerings, failure to expand into certain emerging markets, risks from operating internationally, and tax law changes. We disclaim and do not undertake any obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statement in
this Form 10-Q. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">40 </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc81259_9"></A>Item&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures about Market Risk.
</B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">As Kraft Foods operates globally, we use certain financial instruments to manage our foreign currency exchange rate, commodity price and interest rate
risks. We monitor and manage these exposures as part of our overall risk management program. Our risk management program focuses on the unpredictability of financial markets and seeks to reduce the potentially adverse effects that the volatility of
these markets may have on our operating results. We maintain foreign currency, commodity price and interest rate risk management policies that principally use derivative instruments to reduce significant, unanticipated earnings fluctuations that may
arise from volatility in foreign currency exchange rates, commodity prices and interest rates. We also sell commodity futures to unprice future purchase commitments, and we occasionally use related futures to cross-hedge a commodity exposure. We are
not a party to leveraged derivatives and, by policy, do not use financial instruments for speculative purposes. Refer to Note 9, <I>Financial Instruments</I>, for further information on the types of derivative instruments we used to hedge our
exposures. There were no significant changes in our exposures or the types of derivative instruments we use since December&nbsp;31, 2008, other than those discussed in Note 1, <I>Summary of Significant Accounting Policies</I>. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:36px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc81259_10"></A>Item&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and Procedures. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Evaluation of Disclosure Controls and Procedures </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Management, together with our CEO and CFO, evaluated the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rule 13a-15(e)) as of the end of the period covered by this report. Based upon that evaluation, the
CEO and CFO concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Changes in Internal Control Over Financial Reporting </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">Management, together with our CEO and CFO, evaluated the changes in our internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2009, and noted the following significant changes. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In 2008, we began implementing &#147;Catalyst,&#148; a business initiative to simplify and harmonize our systems processes. This multi-year program includes the
delivery of SAP enterprise software applications and business solutions. During the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2009, we transitioned some of our processes and procedures into the SAP control environment. As we migrate to the SAP environment, our
management ensures that our key controls are mapped to applicable SAP controls, tests transition controls prior to the migration date of those controls, and as appropriate, maintains and evaluates controls over the flow of information to and from
SAP. We expect the transition period to be completed in 2011. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">&#149;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Effective January 2009, we began reorganizing our European operations to function on a pan-European centralized category management and value chain model. During
the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2009, we transitioned some of our processes and procedures to the new structure. As we transition to the new structure, our management ensures that our key controls are migrated and maintained. We expect the
transition period to be completed in the second quarter of 2010. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">We determined that there were no other changes in our
internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2009, that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc81259_11"></A>PART II &#150; OTHER INFORMATION </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc81259_12"></A>Item&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;Legal Proceedings. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">We are involved, from time to time, in legal proceedings, claims, and governmental inspections or investigations, arising in the ordinary course of our business. While we cannot predict with certainty the results of these matters, we do not
expect that the ultimate costs to resolve these matters will have a material effect on our financial results. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:36px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2"><B><A NAME="toc81259_13"></A>Item&nbsp;1A.&nbsp;&nbsp;Risk Factors. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There were no material changes to the risk factors disclosed in our Form
10-K for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2008, in response to Item&nbsp;1A, <I>Risk Factors</I>, to Part I of our report. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">41 </FONT></P>

</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The following activity represents shares tendered to us by employees who used shares to exercise options, and shares tendered to us by employees who
vested in restricted and deferred stock and used shares to pay the related taxes. As such, these are non-cash transactions. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DESCRIPTION>OFFER OF EMPLOYMENT LETTER, BETWEEN KRAFT FOODS AND W. ANTHONY VERNON
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Offer of Employment Letter, between Kraft Foods and W. Anthony Vernon</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT 10.2 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px">

<IMG SRC="g81259ex102_pg1.jpg" ALT="LOGO"> </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">PERSONAL AND CONFIDENTIAL </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">June&nbsp;17, 2009 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Mr.&nbsp;Tony Vernon </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Dear Tony,
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I am very pleased to provide you with this letter confirming the verbal offer that has been extended to you for the position of President Kraft Foods
North America located in Northfield, Illinois, USA. As discussed, we are interested in you joining Kraft Foods on August&nbsp;17, 2009. This letter sets forth all of the terms and conditions of the offer. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Listed below are details of your compensation and benefits that will apply to this offer. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Annualized Compensation </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="90%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD></TD>
<TD></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Annual Base Salary</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">725,000</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Target Management Incentive Plan &#150; (90%*)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">652,500</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Target Long-Term Incentive Plan &#150; (150%*)</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1,087,500</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Target Annual Equity Award</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1,475,000</FONT></TD></TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#cceeff">
<TD VALIGN="top"> <P STYLE="margin-left:1.00em; text-indent:-1.00em"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Total Annual Target Compensation</FONT></P></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3,940,000</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="line-height:8px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:2px;border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000;width:10%">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Target as a percent of base salary. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Annual Incentive Plan </U></B>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">You will be eligible to participate in the Kraft Management Incentive Plan (MIP), which is the Company&#146;s annual incentive program. Your target award
opportunity under the MIP is equal to 90% of your base salary. The actual amount you will receive may be lower or higher depending on your individual performance and the performance of Kraft Foods Inc. Your 2009 award will be payable in March 2010.
Your MIP eligibility will begin on your date of employment. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">June 17, 2009 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 2 of 4
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Long-Term Incentive Plan </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">You will also be eligible to participate in the Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP), which is the Company&#146;s executive long-term performance share program. The current LTIP performance cycle began on January&nbsp;1,
2009 and is scheduled to end on December&nbsp;31, 2011. Your LTIP eligibility will begin with this performance cycle as if you were employed by Kraft Foods on January&nbsp;1, 2009. Your target opportunity under the LTIP is equal to 150% of your base
salary at the beginning of the performance cycle. The actual amount you will receive may be lower or higher depending upon the performance of Kraft Foods Inc. during the performance cycle. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A new three-year performance cycle starts at the beginning of each year. This structure creates overlapping performance cycles. For example, your first payout under this
program will be made in the first quarter of 2012 for the 2009-2011 performance cycle. Your second award payout will be in the following year (2013)&nbsp;for the performance period of 2010-2012. Similarly, you will continue to be eligible to earn an
award payout each year thereafter based on the three-year trailing performance period. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Stock Program </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Also, you will be eligible to participate in the Company&#146;s stock award program. Stock awards are typically made on an annual basis, with the next award anticipated
to be granted in the first quarter of 2010. Awards are delivered as follows: 50% of equity value in restricted stock and 50% in stock options. Actual award size is based on individual potential and performance. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Sign-On Incentives </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In recognition of the loss of short-term
and long-term incentives from your previous employer, upon hire, you will receive one-time sign-on incentives in the form of restricted stock as follows: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" ALIGN="center">

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="19%"></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom" WIDTH="3%"></TD>
<TD WIDTH="78%"></TD></TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="top" NOWRAP><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Equity&nbsp;Sign-On&nbsp;Incentive</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD VALIGN="bottom"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">$1,000,000 restricted stock award to vest one-third each year over a three-year period</FONT></TD></TR>
</TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If prior to full vesting of the sign-on restricted shares granted per this offer letter, your employment with the
Company ends due to involuntary termination for reasons other than cause, the value of the total number of unvested shares shall vest on the scheduled vesting dates. The number of shares that you will receive will be determined based upon the fair
market value of Kraft Foods Inc. Common Stock on your date of hire. You will receive dividends on the shares during the vesting period consistent in amount and timing with that of Common Stock shareholders. The other terms and conditions set forth
in Kraft Foods&#146; standard Stock Award Agreements will apply. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">June 17, 2009 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 3 of 4
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of this offer letter, &#147;cause&#148; means: 1) continued failure to substantially perform the job&#146;s
duties (other than resulting from incapacity due to disability); 2) gross negligence, dishonesty, or violation of any reasonable rule or regulation of the Company where the violation results in significant damage to the Company; or 3) engaging in
other conduct which materially adversely reflects on the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Perquisites </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">You will be eligible for a company car allowance equal to $15,000 per year under the executive perquisite policy. You will also be eligible for an annual financial counseling allowance of $7,500. You may use any firm
of your choosing. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Stock Ownership Guidelines </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">You will be required to attain and hold Company stock equal in value to $4,000,000. You will have five years from your date of employment to achieve this level of ownership. Stock held for ownership determination includes common stock held
directly or indirectly, unvested restricted stock or share equivalents held in the Company&#146;s 401(k) plan. It does not include unexercised stock option shares or unearned performance shares. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:18px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>Other Benefits </U></B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Your offer includes Kraft Foods&#146;
comprehensive benefits package available to full-time salaried employees. This benefits package is described in the enclosed Kraft Foods Benefits Summary brochure. You will be eligible for 6 weeks (30 days) of paid time off. In addition, you are
eligible for ten designated holidays. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">You will be a U.S. employee of Kraft Foods and your employment status will be governed by and shall be construed in
accordance with the laws of the United States. As such, your status will be that of an &#147;at will&#148; employee. This means that either you or Kraft Foods is free to terminate the employment relationship at any time, for any reason. </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If your employment with the Company ends due to involuntary termination other than for cause, you will receive severance arrangements no less favorable than those
accorded recently terminated senior executives of the Company. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To assist in your relocation from Pennsylvania to Illinois, we offer relocation assistance
as outlined in Kraft Foods&#146; Relocation Guide. </FONT></P>

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">June 17, 2009 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Page 4 of 4
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">This offer is contingent upon successful completion of our pre-employment checks, which may include a background screen,
reference check, and post-offer drug test pursuant to testing procedures determined by Kraft Foods. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If you have any questions, I can be reached at the
office at (xxx)&nbsp;xxx-xxxx or on my cell phone at (xxx)&nbsp;xxx-xxxx. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Sincerely, </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>EXHIBIT 31.1 </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Certifications </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:7%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I, Irene B. Rosenfeld, certify that: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">I have reviewed this quarterly report on Form 10-Q of Kraft Foods Inc.; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the
circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of
operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this report; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">4.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e)
and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the registrant and have: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information
relating to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our supervision, to provide reasonable
assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions): </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.

<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant&#146;s disclosure controls and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure
controls and procedures, as of the end of the period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#146;s most recent fiscal quarter (the
registrant&#146;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to materially affect, the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="7%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The registrant&#146;s other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting, to the registrant&#146;s
auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions): </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably likely to adversely affect the
registrant&#146;s ability to record, process, summarize and report financial information; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="12%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Date: August&nbsp;5, 2009 </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P><DIV ALIGN="right">

Foods&#148;), certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that Kraft Foods&#146; Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q for the quarter ended June&nbsp;30, 2009, fully complies

&lt;tbody&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td valign="top" colspan="13"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note
2.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Divestitures:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Post Cereals
Split-off:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;On August&amp;#160;4, 2008, we completed the
split-off of the &lt;i&gt;Post&lt;/i&gt; cereals business into Ralcorp
Holdings, Inc., after an exchange with our shareholders.
Accordingly, we restated prior period results to reflect the
results of the &lt;i&gt;Post&lt;/i&gt; cereals business as discontinued
operations on the condensed consolidated statement of earnings.
Refer to our Form 10-K for the year ended December&amp;#160;31, 2008
for further details of this transaction.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Summary results of operations for the
&lt;i&gt;Post&lt;/i&gt; cereals business for the three and six months ended
June&amp;#160;30, 2008 were as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

size="2"&gt;123&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

&lt;td valign="top" colspan="13"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Other Divestitures:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;In the second quarter of 2009, we
received $6 million in proceeds and recorded pre-tax losses of $17
million on the divestitures of a juice operation in Brazil and a
plant in Spain.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;

&lt;/div&gt;

</us-gaap:DisposalGroupsIncludingDiscontinuedOperationsDisclosureTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:EarningsPerShareBasic contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0" unitRef="USDperShareItemType" decimals="2">1.01</us-gaap:EarningsPerShareBasic>
  <us-gaap:EarningsPerShareDiluted contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0" unitRef="USDperShareItemType" decimals="2">1.00</us-gaap:EarningsPerShareDiluted>
  <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0">&lt;div&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 10.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Commitments
and Contingencies:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Legal Proceedings:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We are involved, from time to time, in
legal proceedings, claims, and governmental inspections or
investigations, arising in the ordinary course of our business.
While we cannot predict with certainty the results of these
matters, we do not expect that the ultimate costs to resolve these
matters will have a material effect on our financial
results.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Third-Party
Guarantees:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We have third-party guarantees because
of our construction activities. As part of those transactions, we
guarantee that third parties will make contractual payments or
achieve performance measures. At June&amp;#160;30, 2009, the carrying
amount of our third-party guarantees on our condensed consolidated
balance sheet and the maximum potential payment under these
guarantees was $30 million. Substantially all of these guarantees
expire at various times through 2018.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font size=
"1"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;

</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesDisclosureTextBlock>

&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=

&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Fair Value of Derivative
Instruments:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;The fair values of derivative
instruments recorded in the condensed consolidated balance sheet as
of June&amp;#160;30, 2009 were:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size=

&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;

"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&lt;/p&gt;

"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font size=
"1"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We include the fair value of our asset
derivatives within other current assets and the fair value of our
liability derivatives within other current liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;The fair values (asset / (liability)) of
our derivative instruments at June&amp;#160;30, 2009 were determined
using:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;

"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

size="2"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;

size="2"&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom" nowrap="nowrap"&gt;&lt;font face="Times New Roman"
size="2"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;font size="1"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr style="FONT-SIZE: 1px"&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double" valign="bottom"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double" valign="bottom"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double" valign="bottom"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="BORDER-TOP: #000000 3px double" valign="bottom"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td valign="bottom"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td valign="top" colspan="18"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We record both (i)&amp;#160;the gain or loss
reclassified from AOCI into earnings and (ii)&amp;#160;the gain or loss
on ineffectiveness in:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;cost of sales for
commodity contracts;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;cost of sales or
marketing, administration and research costs for foreign exchange
contracts related to forecasted transactions, depending on the type
of transaction; and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;interest and other
expense, net for foreign exchange contracts related to intercompany
loans and interest rate contracts.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We expect to transfer unrealized losses
of $31 million (net of taxes) for commodity cash flow hedges and
unrealized gains of $26 million (net of taxes) for foreign currency
cash flow hedges to earnings during the next 12 months. As of
June&amp;#160;30, 2009, we had hedged forecasted:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;commodity
transactions for periods not exceeding the next 18
months;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;interest rate
transactions for periods not exceeding the next 148 months;
and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;foreign currency
transactions for periods not exceeding the next 30 months, and
excluding intercompany loans, we had hedged forecasted foreign
currency transactions for periods not exceeding the next 12
months.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;

&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We recognized net gains on commodity
contracts not designated as hedging instruments of approximately
$225 million during the three months and approximately $285 million
during the six months ended June&amp;#160;30, 2008, directly as a
component of cost of sales. See our Form 10-K for the year ended
December&amp;#160;31, 2008 for additional information on our purpose
for entering into derivatives not designated as hedging instruments
and our overall risk management strategies.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;

notes&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

</us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsAndHedgingActivitiesDisclosureTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:DisclosureOfShareBasedCompensationArrangementsByShareBasedPaymentAwardTextBlock contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0">&lt;div&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" align="center"
border="0"&gt;
&lt;tbody&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td valign="top" colspan="11"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 7.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Stock
Plans:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;At our annual meeting of shareholders
held on May&amp;#160;20, 2009, our shareholders approved the Kraft
Foods Inc. Amended and Restated 2005 Performance Incentive Plan.
The amended plan includes, among other provisions, a limit on the
number of shares that may be granted under the plan, vesting
restrictions and a prohibition on stock option repricing. Under the
amended plan, we are authorized to issue a maximum of
168.0&amp;#160;million shares of our Common Stock. As of the effective
date of the amendment, there were 92.1 million shares available to
be granted under the plan, of which no more than 27.5&amp;#160;million
shares may be awarded as restricted or deferred stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;In January 2009, we granted
1.4&amp;#160;million shares of stock in connection with our long-term
incentive plan. The market value per share was $27.00 on the date
of grant. The unvested shares have no voting rights and do not pay
dividends.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;In February 2009, as part of our annual
incentive program, we issued 4.1&amp;#160;million shares of restricted
and deferred stock to eligible U.S. and non-U.S. employees. The
market value per restricted or deferred share was $23.64 on the
date of grant. Also, as part of our annual incentive program, we
granted 16.3&amp;#160;million stock options to eligible U.S. and
non-U.S. employees at an exercise price of $23.64.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We also issued 0.2&amp;#160;million
off-cycle shares of restricted and deferred stock during the first
six months of 2009. The weighted-average market value per
restricted or deferred share was $24.90 on the date of grant. In
aggregate, we issued 5.7&amp;#160;million restricted and deferred
shares during the first six months of 2009, including those issued
as part of our long-term incentive plan.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;During the first six months of 2009,
5.2&amp;#160;million shares of restricted and deferred stock vested at
a market value of $130 million. There were 3.0&amp;#160;million stock
options exercised during the first six months of 2009 with a total
intrinsic value of $32 million.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;!-- 6 Last_Row * DO NOT REMOVE OR EDIT --&gt;&lt;/tbody&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;

  <us-gaap:EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalents contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0" unitRef="USD" decimals="-6">95000000</us-gaap:EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalents>

&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"1"&gt;(1)&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;This segment was formerly known as
European Union.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td valign="top" colspan="13"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;As discussed in Note 12, &lt;i&gt;Segment
Reporting&lt;/i&gt;, we implemented changes to our operating structure in
2009. As a result of these changes, we aligned the reporting of our
Central Europe operations into our Kraft Foods Developing Markets
segment and moved $1,534 million of goodwill from Kraft Foods
Europe to Kraft Foods Developing Markets as of January&amp;#160;1,
2009. We restated prior period segment results in a consistent
manner.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;

&lt;td valign="top" colspan="13"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Non-amortizable intangible assets
consist substantially of brand names purchased through our
acquisitions of Nabisco Holdings Corp., the global &lt;i&gt;LU&lt;/i&gt;
biscuit business of Groupe Danone S.A. and the Spanish and
Portuguese operations of United Biscuits. Amortizable intangible
assets consist primarily of trademark licenses, customer-related
intangibles and non-compete agreements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Amortization expense for intangible
assets was $3 million for the three months and $9 million for the
six months ended June&amp;#160;30, 2009. We currently estimate
amortization expense for each of the next five years to be
approximately $20 million or less.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 8.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Benefit
Plans:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Pension Plans&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Components of Net Periodic Pension
Cost:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Net periodic pension cost consisted of
the following for the three and six months ended June&amp;#160;30, 2009
and 2008:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;The following costs are included in
settlement losses above. Severance benefits from our cost-savings
initiatives and retiring employees who elected lump-sum payments
resulted in settlement losses for our U.S. plans of $40 million for
the three months and $66 million for the six months ended
June&amp;#160;30, 2009, and $13 million for the three months and $21
million for the six months ended June&amp;#160;30, 2008.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;Employer
Contributions:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;We make contributions to our U.S. and
non-U.S. pension plans, primarily to the extent that they are tax
deductible and do not generate an excise tax liability. During the
first six months of 2009, we contributed $219 million to our U.S.
plans (including the $200 million contribution we made on May 1,
2009) and $86 million to our non-U.S. plans. Based on current tax
law, we plan to make further contributions of approximately $20
million to our U.S. plans and approximately $80 million to our
non-U.S. plans during the remainder of 2009. However, our actual
contributions may differ due to many factors, including changes in
tax and other benefit laws, or significant differences between
expected and actual pension asset performance or interest
rates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font size=
"1"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Postretirement Benefit

"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Net postretirement health care costs

June&amp;#160;30, 2009 and 2008:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=

&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Net postemployment costs consisted of
the following for the three and six months ended June&amp;#160;30, 2009
and 2008:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1px"&gt;

&lt;td valign="bottom" colspan="18"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;The following costs are included in
other (credits) / costs above. We incurred $25 million in severance
charges in the second quarter of 2009 related to our Kraft Foods
Europe Reorganization. We also reversed $32 million in severance
charges in the second quarter of 2009 related to our Restructuring
Program as we sold a plant in Spain that we previously announced
for closure under the program. Additionally, the postemployment
cost of workforce reduction initiatives announced under the
Restructuring Program was $64 million during the three months and
$123 million during the six months ended June&amp;#160;30,
2008.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

  <us-gaap:ProceedsFromRepaymentsOfShortTermDebt contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0" unitRef="USD" decimals="-6">-41000000</us-gaap:ProceedsFromRepaymentsOfShortTermDebt>
  <us-gaap:ProceedsFromDivestitureOfBusinessesNetOfCashDivested contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0" unitRef="USD" decimals="-6">6000000</us-gaap:ProceedsFromDivestitureOfBusinessesNetOfCashDivested>

  <us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedActivitiesDisclosureTextBlock contextRef="eol_PE71240---0910-Q0005_STD_p6m_20090630_0">&lt;div&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" align="center"
border="0"&gt;
&lt;tbody&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td valign="top" colspan="17"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 5.&amp;#160;&amp;#160;Restructuring
Costs:&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;&lt;i&gt;2004 &amp;#8211; 2008 Restructuring
Program:&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;In 2008, we completed our five-year
restructuring program (the &amp;#8220;Restructuring Program&amp;#8221;).
The Restructuring Program&amp;#8217;s objectives were to leverage our
global scale, realign and lower our cost structure, and optimize
capacity. As part of the Restructuring Program, we:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;incurred $3.0
billion in pre-tax charges reflecting asset disposals, severance
and implementation costs;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;announced the
closure of 35 facilities and announced the elimination of
approximately 18,800 positions; and&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style=
"MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px; MARGIN-LEFT: 4em; TEXT-INDENT: -1.5em"&gt;
&lt;font face="Times New Roman" size=
"2"&gt;&amp;#8226;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;will use cash to pay
for $2.0 billion of the $3.0 billion in charges.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;In the second quarter of 2009, we sold a
plant in Spain that we previously announced for closure under our
Restructuring Program. Accordingly, we reversed $35 million in
Restructuring Program charges during the second quarter of 2009,
primarily related to severance, and recorded a $17 million loss on
the divestiture of the plant. The reversal of the Restructuring
Program costs, which affected the segment operating income of the
Kraft Foods Europe segment, was recorded within asset impairment
and exit costs. Since the inception of the Restructuring Program,
we have paid cash for $1.6 billion of the $3.0 billion in charges,
including $80 million paid in the first six months of 2009. At
June&amp;#160;30, 2009, we had an accrual of $399 million, and we had
eliminated approximately 16,000 positions under the Restructuring
Program.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Restructuring liability activity for the
six months ended June&amp;#160;30, 2009 was:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;td valign="top" colspan="17"&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; FONT-SIZE: 12px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0px"&gt;
&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="MARGIN-TOP: 0px; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 1px"&gt;&lt;font face=
"Times New Roman" size="2"&gt;Our 2009 activity was related to the
aforementioned reversal of $35 million and cash outflows on prior
year Restructuring Program charges. Our prior year severance
charges included the cost of benefits received by terminated
employees. Other prior year costs related primarily to the
renegotiation of supplier contract costs, workforce reductions
associated with facility closings and the termination of leasing
agreements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
